intro: Austroblechnum lherminieri, commonly known as the New Zealand fern, is a species of fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky areas. Its rhizomes are often covered in a dense layer of brownish, hairy tissue. Austroblechnum lherminieri plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
